snippet: An outbreak of listeria tied to contaminated Danish meat has killed 12 people since last September, with most of the deaths in the past three months, the Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Fisheries said Tuesday.
abstract: Denmark's Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Fisheries says that listeria outbreak tied to contaminated Danish meat has killed 12 people since September 2013.
lead_paragraph: An outbreak of listeria tied to contaminated Danish meat has killed 12 people since last September, with most of the deaths in the past three months, the Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Fisheries said Tuesday.

headline.main: Denmark: Fatal Outbreak Tied to Meat
headline.print_headline: Denmark: Fatal Outbreak Tied to Meat
